answers.author: Pooja Varma
answers.text:
Hello,
Here are a few documents that should prove useful: 
-The City of Warwick, R.I. application package includes the Community Development Block Grant Funding Policy and Evaluation Criteria. 
http://www.warwickri.gov/pdfs/comdev/CDBG%20APPLICATION%20PACKAGE.pdf 
-A resolution from the mayor and council of the Town of Oro Valley, Ariz. that authorizes the amendment of the policy and procedure for community funding programs and includes the policy as Exhibit A.  
icma.org/Documents/QuestionAnswer/Document/7544
-The CDBG Public Service Grant Fact Sheet and Funding Policy from Gaithersburg, M.D.  
http://www.gaithersburgmd.gov/Documents/community_development/08_facts_in_brief.pdf 
-The Community Assistance Framework and Funding Policies – Council Policy from Hamilton City, New Zealand that provides the overarching objectives and rationale for the framework. 
http://hamilton.co.nz/index.aspx?PageID=2145827719 
I hope this is helpful,
Pooja Varma
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
pvarma@icma.org

author: Pamela Muse
text:
The City of Lethbridge is looking for a policy to provide interim funding for a not-for-profit community group or organization.  If you have a policy re: emergent grant funding for non-profits, please forward.
Attached FYI is a copy of our draft policy. 
Thank you again.
David Sarsfield
City Clerk's Office
City of Lethbridge
(403)-329-7329  
David.Sarsfield@lethbridge.ca
title: Emergent Grant Funding Policy - Non-profit
